definition: warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated

sentences.english: There was silence as the elegant stomach specialist stood up.
sentences.chinese: 那位温文儒雅的胃病专家起立时室内一片寂静。

sentences.english: So who is the debonair looking guy in the photograph above?
sentences.chinese: 谁是我们在上面照片中看到的那个温文尔雅的人呢？

sentences.english: He's very smooth with the ladies. They are all very fond of his presence.
sentences.chinese: 他在女孩们面前总是温文儒雅，她们都喜欢与他为伴。

sentences.english: She is a cultured and bright girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个温文尔雅，聪明伶俐的女孩。

sentences.english: For the first time her veneer of politeness began to crack.
sentences.chinese: 她温文尔雅的外表第一次露出破绽。

sentences.english: Her only asset was a gentle nature.
sentences.chinese: 她唯一的可贵之处是温文尔雅的性情。

sentences.english: The headvertisementswaiter was debonair with the guests but firm with the waiters.
sentences.chinese: 领班对来宾温文有礼，但是对侍者却很倔强。

sentences.english: The little girl isgentleandcultivatedand everybody likes her.
sentences.chinese: 这小姑娘温文尔雅，大家都很喜欢她。

sentences.english: Then, last of all, I desiderate urbanity.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我渴望练就温文尔雅的性情。
他的行为举止非常温文儒雅。

sentences.english: I like it like the small white rabbit, gentle, naughty lovely personality.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢小白兔，喜欢它温文尔雅，淘气可爱的性格。

sentences.english: The meek will usufriend wait patiently for the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 温文的人一定会耐性地等候主。

sentences.english: On can always be kind to people one cares nothing about.
sentences.chinese: 对于哪些偶们漠不关心地人，偶们总能做到温文尔雅。

sentences.english: She took a glasses, talk in class to stomach.
sentences.chinese: 她带着一个眼镜，讲起课来温文尔雅。

sentences.english: My new teacher is a very gentle person.
sentences.chinese: 我的新老师是一个温文尔雅的人。

definition: cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
